title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
Hi all, I have an 820-3115 that is having issues. Came in with no liquid damage, customer reported they were watching a movie and it shut off unexpectedly. I get intermittent green light but it only pulls 0.013A from the bench PSU. Found that PP5V_S3 was shorted to ground (0.30ohm) and injected 1v, found C6213 to heat up so I removed it. Short is clear now but still not getting PP5V_S3.

PPBUS_G3H: 12.6v
PP3V3_SUS: 0v
SMC_ADAPTER_EN: 0v
PM_DSW_PWRGD: 0v
PCH_DSWVRMEN: 3.3v
PM_BATLOW_L: 0v
PCH_SRTCRST_L: 3.4v
PPVRTC_G3H: 3.4v
RTC_RESET_L: 3.4v

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
Post U7200 basic voltage; pins 16, 13, 3, 8, 17, 6.
Do you get SMC_PM_G2_EN?

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message: Check diode mode to ground at VREF and VREG3/5.

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
VREF: 687
VREG3: 464
VREG5: 516

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
Then change U7200.
Be sure to have good solders and traces.
Also check diode mode to ground at L7220/60.

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
Changed U7200, double checked all the solders/traces. Am now getting 
VREF: 679 
VREG3: 637 
VREG5: 503

L7260 seems really low, diode is 144, L7220 is 390. Does this mean something is pulling PP5V_S3 down?

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message: Post again U7200 voltages; above mentioned pins.

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
Whoops, sorry. Completely forgot to check again.

U7200
3: 2v
6: 0.757v
8: 3.3v
13: 3.3v
16: 12.6v
17: 5v

So PP5V_S5 has returned.

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message: Just to check my understanding so far. U7200 needs Pin 6 to be low, Pin 13 to be high, and 13/17 to be at 3.3v and 5v. So this chip is now functioning correctly?

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
"U7200 needs Pin 6 to be low"
Don't make wrong assumptions so easy!
However, 0.757V is the correct voltage there; theoretical value is 10uAx78.7Kohm=0.787V.
Chip's datasheet explains why.

You should now have 3V3_S5 present at L7220.

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message: I do now have 3V3_S5 present at L7220. I don't have PP5V_S3 though. PM_SLP_S4_L is 0v. C1802/1803 are 3.3v

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
Update: After reading some forum posts, I replaced U2600 on a hunch. I now get consistent green light.

PP5V_S3: [B]3.3V[/B]
PM_SLP_S4_L: 3.3V

Power supply is drawing 0.226A. No fan spin.

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
PM_SLP_S3_L should be also high.
Check that, as all voltages controlled by this signal too.

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message: Looks like  PM_SLP_S3_L is also 3.3v

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
Then you should have voltage in many S3 and S0 power rails; not CPU maybe.
ALL_SYS_PWRGD goes high?

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message: Looks like ALL_SYS_PWRGD is still low. Will do some backtracking and see what rails I'm missing

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message: Remove Q7950 and check ALL_SYS_PWRGD again.

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message: ALL_SYS_PWRGD still low (0.027v) with Q7950 removed.

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
Q7950
1: 0.033V
5: 1.075V
6: 3.29V
7: 1.505V

Also noticing now that the PCH gets hot after sitting plugged in for 5 or so mins. I take it that's not good...

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
Let Q7950 out for the moment; is not really needed at all in fact.

Remove R7963-66 (one by one), until ALL_SYS_PWRGD goes high.
Keep in place R7967.

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
Had to lift R7963, R7964, and R7965 then ALL_SYS_PWRGD went high. No change otherwise though, other than....

This last time I plugged the board in, I noticed this time it was only pulling 0.009A and I lost my power rails. Touched the board to move it around and something burned my finger on the bottom corner of the board. Looked under the scope and applied some alcohol and it was D5802 that was heating up. Replaced this from a donor, now I'm back where I was with ~0.220A from the PSU and the same rails present. This board is turning into a nightmare lol

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
Which was the last resistor removed, before ALL_SYS_PWRGD going high?
Check its corresponding power supply.

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message: It was R7965, so the finger points back to U7200. Pin 23 is only 0.204V and diode is 212. That seemed low so I checked in ohms, the meter was flashing OL without ever being able to settle on a number. Not sure where else to go from here.

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
So ALL_SYS_PWRGD is high if you put the other resistors back?
Which is the exact 3V3_S5 and 5V_S3 voltage?

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
Sorry, I misunderstood your process for removing the resistors, after reading some more threads I realized you wanted me to remove one, test, then replace that one and move onto the next - I removed one, then left that one off and moved onto the next. 

I just re-tested by replacing R7964 and R7965 and checking with R7963 off, then replacing R7963 and removing R7964, then replacing R7964 and removing R7965. In all three tests, ALL_SYS_PWRGD stays low, only if I remove all 3 resistors does it go high.

3V3_S5: 3.330V
5V_S3 : 3.345V

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message: Check L7100 amd L7630 voltage, when all 3 resistors removed.

title: 820-3115 Power Issues
message:
"5V_S3 : 3.345V"
Ooops, I meesed this.

So check all components 5V_S3 related, near U7200.
